column4: Hi.  I was wondering if it's possible to start an Ubuntu install from a Live distro that isn't Ubuntu or Knoppix.
Cuz it's what I have on hand.
I don't want to buy a new flash drive or external CD-ROM for my netbook
No, I mean a netbook install
I have an existing linux live distro (i'm on it now), and I want to install ubuntu to my hard drive.  this is currently running off an SD card
they will support an ubuntu install there, but not here?
thanks, i'll be sure to tell them you sent me
yes, but that will destroy my working backtrack
Why don't you want to install Ubuntu to the internal hard drive?
I rest my case.  You could have stuck with a standard laptop
that's nice.  i appreciate your opinion.  now, can the ubuntu installer be called from an existing linux enviornment?
Not that I am aware of.  I have never tried installing Ubuntu from BackTrack 3
Your best bet is to just burn Ubuntu to the flash drive, then install it onto the hard drive then reinstall BackTrack 3 to the flash drive
It would have been better if you would have had access to a CD drive
